article.title: Probing Left-Right Seesaw using Beam Polarization at an $e^+e^-$ Collider

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following processes does NOT contribute to the dominant pair-production and decay modes of the heavy neutrino at an e+e- collider, as shown in Figure 1?

Figure 2 compares unpolarized and polarized cross sections for the process e+e− → NN → e±e± + 4j at √s = 500 GeV. What is the MAIN effect of switching on beam polarization for the large mixing scenario (|Ven|² = 10⁻²)?
choices: The cross section is suppressed for both left and right-polarized electrons.
The cross section is enhanced for left-polarized electrons and suppressed for right-polarized electrons.
The cross section is enhanced for both left and right-polarized electrons.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 depicts 95% CL sensitivity contours for the proposed signal in the (MWR, MN) plane. What is the MAIN advantage of the proposed method using beam polarization at an e+e− collider compared to other existing and future projections, like HL-LHC and LHeC?
choices: It can probe lower MN values.
It is sensitive to a wider range of |Ven|² values.
It offers greater sensitivity to higher MWR masses for kinematically accessible heavy neutrinos.
It is not sensitive to the displaced vertex scenario.

multiple_choice_question.text: Equation (4) describes the total cross section of the proposed signal. Which statement BEST describes the meaning of the terms in the equation?
choices: It shows that the signal is independent of the heavy neutrino branching ratio.
It assumes that the heavy neutrino always decays to two jets.
It factors in both the production cross-section of the heavy neutrinos and their subsequent decay to the final state.
It proves that the signal is only relevant for large light-heavy neutrino mixing.
